Platform.Title: Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome Array

Sample.Title: 1655 delta tnaA exposed to low levels of norfloxacin, t0

Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Continuous culture (0.48/hr) of MG1655∆tnaA in LB
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was obtained using the RNEasy Protect Bacterial Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to manufacturer's instructions.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: Biotinylated cDNA was prepared using an Enzo Bioarray Terminal Labeling Kit with Biotin-ddUTP.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Following fragmentation, biotinylated cDNA was hybridized to Affymetrix E. coli Antisense Genome arrays for 16h at 45C and 60rpm.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Genechips were scanned at 532nm using an Affymetrix Gene Scanner 3000
Sample.Description: Gene expression data for 1655 delta tnaA exposed to low levels of norfloxacin, t0
Sample.Data-Processing: Data were normalized with FARMS and updated CDF (custom)

Sample.Description: Gene expression data for 1655 delta tnaA exposed to low levels of indole and norfloxacin, t2

Sample.Title: 1655 delta tnaA reexposed to low levels of norfloxacin, t3

Series.Title: Expression data from indole deficient E.coli (MG1655∆tnaA) exposed to indole and norfloxacin during continuous culture
Series.Summary: We sought to determine the effect of indole on cells under antibiotic stress.
Series.Overall-Design: To determine the effects of indole during norfloxacin treatment, we continuously cultured MG1655_delta_tnaA and exposed the culture to three conditions: 1. initial exposure to norfloxacin, 2. exposure to indole and norfloxacin, and 3. reexposure to norfloxacin
